definition: to be utterly defeated/to be routed
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither

sentences.english: That defeat proved to be Spain’s only loss of the tournament.
sentences.chinese: 这次败北是西班牙此次世界杯摘冠之旅唯一败绩。

sentences.english: And he hasn't lost since Erik Morales outpointed him in 2005.
sentences.chinese: 自2005年点数输给莫拉雷斯以来，至今无败绩。

sentences.english: The morale of the football team was very low after its defeat.
sentences.chinese: 遭受败绩之后，那支足球队士气相当低落。

sentences.english: We hope Michael Chang is soon on the rebound from a losing streak.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望张德培很快从一连败绩的阴影中走出来。

sentences.english: He had been made the scapegoat for all the failures of the Luftwaffe.
sentences.chinese: 他就是德国空军各次败绩的替罪羊。

definition: to lose a war/fig. the loser (in a competition or election)
to defeat/to inflict a defeat on sb
(literary) to be routed (in a war)/to suffer defeat (in sports etc)
total victory/to excel by far/name of a tank/slam
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
fighting and winning a series of battles (idiom); ever victorious
to cross swords/to have a confrontation (with sb)
opponent/substantial adversary/worthy match/antagonist/in the enemy's hands
